title: Weathers injures right index finger
subtitle: Weathers injures right index finger
body: After 15 years of consistency in the big leagues, David Weathers' pitching skills are beyond reproach. His catching skills, though, are under review now. Weathers suffered a torn extensor tendon in his right index finger while playing catch at home Tuesday. He is expected to be in a splint for three weeks. Anthony Castrovince is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Anthony Castrovince
